recipes.title: Veggie Breakfast Tacos

ingredients.serrano: ½ to 1 serrano pepper, thinly sliced
ingredients.pepper: 1 green pepper, cored, stem removed, and diced
ingredients.salt: sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

description.stepOne: Make the Salsa: In a small bowl, combine the tomato, onion, cilantro, serrano, garlic, lime juice and salt. Chill until ready to use.
description.stepTwo: In a small nonstick skillet, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat. Add the green pepper, scallions and a pinch of salt and pepper and sauté until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Scoop a large spoonful of the salsa into the pepper mixture and stir. Remove from the heat and set aside.
description.stepThree: Brush a large nonstick stick skillet lightly with olive oil and bring to medium heat. Add the eggs, let them cook for a few seconds and then stir. Add the green pepper mixture to the eggs. Continue to stir and scramble the eggs until just set. Remove from the pan from the heat while the eggs are slightly runny and stir in the arugula and half of the extra cilantro.
description.stepFour: Assemble the tacos with the egg mixture, a scoop of salsa, the remaining cilantro and a few slices of avocado. Finish with a squeeze of lime and a pinch of salt and pepper, if desired. Garnish with cilantro and serve with lime wedges.

recipes.intro: Healthy Breakfast Ideas: Veggie Breakfast Tacos

recipes.title: Baked Oatmeal

ingredients.milk: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk, at room temperature

description.stepOne: Preheat the oven to 350°F and grease an 8x8-inch or similar baking dish.
description.stepTwo: In a large bowl, whisk together the mashed banana, almond milk, almond butter, maple syrup, and coconut oil. Add the baking powder, cinnamon, and salt and whisk again.
description.stepThree: Fold in the oats, ¾ cup of the pecans, and ½ cup of the blueberries. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and smooth into an even layer.
description.stepFour: Top with the remaining ½ cup blueberries, the remaining ¼ cup pecans, the brown sugar, and coconut flakes.
description.stepFive: Bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the topping is crisp and the middle is set. Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.intro: This blueberry baked oatmeal recipe is a healthy, delicious breakfast or brunch! I love how the toasty, nutty topping contrasts with the soft and creamy middle. Vegan and gluten-free.

recipes.title: Strawberry Rhubarb Chia Overnight Oat Parfaits

ingredients.mapleSyrup: Drizzle of maple syrup, optional for sweeter oats
ingredients.rhubarb: 1 cup chopped rhubarb (about 1 stalk, ends trimmed)

description.stepOne: Make the jam. In a small saucepan over medium heat, simmer the strawberries, rhubarb, lemon juice, and salt for 10 minutes, stirring often so that the fruit doesn't burn to the bottom of the pot. Remove from the heat and stir in the maple syrup and chia seeds. Let cool to room temperature, 20 to 30 minutes (the rhubarb will continue to soften). Transfer to a jar and chill for at least an hour.
description.stepTwo: Make the oats. Divide the oats into 2 glass jars, pour in the almond milk, a pinch of salt, and maple syrup, if desired. Stir, cover, and chill overnight.
description.stepThree: In the morning, assemble oat jars with a generous scoop of the chia jam.
description.stepFour: If desired, serve with granola, (the crunch is a nice contrast to the soft oats), maple syrup for extra sweetness, and coconut cream if you’re feeling like a decadent breakfast.

recipes.intro: One of my favorite rhubarb recipes, this easy chia jam is delicious over these overnight oat parfaits or slathered onto toast.

recipes.title: Roasted Cauliflower Tacos

ingredients.cauliflower: 1 small cauliflower, outer leaves and core discarded, cut into small florets
ingredients.cabbage: 1 pound red cabbage, thinly sliced (about 1/2 small red cabbage or 6 cups sliced)

description.stepTwo: Place the cauliflower and cabbage on a large sheet pan. Drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with the cumin, coriander, and salt. Use your hands to mix everything together and spread it out into an even layer. Roast, stirring every 15 minutes, until the vegetables are softened and browned in spots, about 45 minutes. (I roasted my cabbage and cauliflower on two separate sheet pans. I cooked the cauliflower for 25 minutes and the cabbage for 10 minutes. Both ways work!)
description.stepThree: Evenly divide the Avocado Sauce and roasted vegetables among the tortillas. Serve immediately with the radishes, serranos, avocado slices, and cilantro, if using.

recipes.intro: This roasted cauliflower tacos recipe is lightly adapted from Simply Julia by Julia Turshen and is reprinted with permission from the publisher. Feel free to get creative with the toppings here! I used what's listed in the recipe below, but Julia also suggests diced white onion, pickled jalapeños, and hot sauce.

recipes.title: https://cdn.loveandlemons.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/sweet-potato-tacos-1024x735.jpg

ingredients.tomatoes: 4 to 6 tortillas, I like these white corn & wheat tortillas, or homemade tortillas
ingredients.basil: 1 cup black beans, cooked, drained, and rinsed
ingredients.oil: Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

description.stepOne: Preheat oven to 400° F and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
description.stepTwo: Toss the sweet potatoes with olive oil, chili powder, salt and pepper, and spread onto the baking sheet. Roast for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
description.stepThree: Make the avocado yogurt sauce: In a small food processor, combine the yogurt, avocado, garlic, lime juice, and a few generous pinches of salt and pepper. Pulse until smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings. Chill until ready to use.
description.stepFour: Assemble the tacos with a scoop of the sauce, the roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, and desired toppings. Season with salt, pepper, and squeezes of lime.

recipes.intro: These easy sweet potato tacos are a delicious vegetarian weeknight dinner that you can easily make vegan or gluten-free.

recipes.title: Margherita Pizza

ingredients.dough: 1 recipe Pizza Dough, stretched onto a 14-inch pizza pan or large baking sheet
ingredients.mozzarella: 8 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, torn or sliced
ingredients.tomatoes: ½ cup thinly sliced cherry tomatoes

description.stepTwo: Spread the pizza sauce onto the dough. Top with the fresh mozzarella and tomatoes and bake 10 to 12 minutes, or until the crust is browned. Remove from the oven and top with fresh basil leaves and a pinch of red pepper flakes. Drizzle with olive oil and serve.

recipes.intro: This homemade margherita pizza recipe is so easy and delicious! My biggest tip for this recipe is to use good-quality ingredients like fresh basil and sauce made with San Marzano tomatoes. Because the recipe is so simple, you'll really taste the difference.

recipes.title: Easy Greek Salad

ingredients.oregano: ½ teaspoon dried oregano, more for sprinkling
ingredients.cucumber: 1 English cucumber, cut lengthwise, seeded, and sliced ¼-inch thick
ingredients.pepper: 1 green bell pepper, chopped into 1-inch pieces
ingredients.feta: 5 ounces feta cheese, cut into ½ inch cubes
ingredients.onion: ⅓ cup thinly sliced red onion

description.stepOne: In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, garlic, oregano, mustard, salt, and several grinds of pepper.
description.stepTwo: On a large platter, arrange the cucumber, green pepper, cherry tomatoes, feta cheese, red onions, and olives. Drizzle with the dressing and very gently toss. Sprinkle with a few generous pinches of oregano and top with the mint leaves. Season to taste and serve.

recipes.intro: One of our favorite salad recipes! This easy Greek salad recipe is a flavorful, refreshing side dish!

recipes.title: Simple Green Salad

ingredients.pepper: Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
ingredients.parmesan: ¼ cup shaved Parmesan or pecorino

description.stepOne: Preheat the oven to 400°F and line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
description.stepTwo: Place the almonds on the first sheet and the grapes on the second. Drizzle the almonds and grapes with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss the almonds with the tamari and roast for 7 to 10 minutes, or until dark and toasty. Roast the grapes for 7 to 15 minutes, until they’re soft and just starting to burst. The timing will depend on the size of the grapes.
description.stepThree: Place the arugula in a large shallow bowl and toss with drizzles of the vinaigrette. Top with the almonds, grapes, and Parmesan. Season to taste and serve.

recipes.intro: Roasted grapes add a delightful sweetness to this simple arugula salad recipe. A fresh, flavorful side dish, it's a perfect addition to a holiday menu or dinner any night of the week.

recipes.title: Avocado Sweet Potato Tacos

ingredients.dressing: 4 to 6 tortillas, I like these white corn & wheat tortillas, or homemade tortillas
ingredients.radishes: 1 cup black beans, cooked, drained, and rinsed
ingredients.cheese: Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

description.stepOne: Assemble bowls with a grain, the massaged kale, a legume, roasted vegetable, raw vegetable, and a fermented or pickled vegetable.
description.stepTwo: Drizzle generously with tahini sauce and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with more tahini sauce on the side.
description.stepThree: To roast the vegetables, preheat the oven to 425°F. Toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast the carrots for 15 to 20 minutes, and the sweet potatoes for 20 to 28 minutes.

recipes.intro: These easy sweet potato tacos are a delicious vegetarian weeknight dinner that you can easily make vegan or gluten-free.

recipes.title: Healthy Lunch Wraps

ingredients.chickpeas: 2 cups cooked chickpeas, drained and rinsed
ingredients.kale: 3 curly kale leaves, stemmed and finely chopped

description.stepOne: Make the dressing. In a blender, combine the oil, vinegar, lemon juice, mustard, honey, garlic, salt, and cheese, if desired. Blend until creamy and emulsified.
description.stepTwo: Make the wrap fillings. In a small bowl, use a potato masher to mash the chickpeas with ¼ cup of the dressing, ¼ teaspoon salt, and several grinds of fresh black pepper.
description.stepThree: In a medium bowl, toss the kale, Brussels sprouts, and radicchio with ⅓ cup of the dressing.
description.stepFour: Assemble the wraps: divide the chickpea mixture, salad mixture, avocado, and cheese, if using, among the tortillas. Fold the left and right sides of the tortilla over the filling. Fold the bottom flap of the tortilla up and over the filling and roll the wrap closed. Wrap in foil, slice in half crosswise, and serve with the remaining dressing on the side for dipping.

recipes.intro: These sandwich wraps are a perfect healthy lunch! They're fresh, satisfying, and packed with bold flavor from the zingy vinaigrette.

recipes.title: Best Egg Salad

description.stepOne: In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, olive oil, mustard, capers, lemon juice, garlic, turmeric, salt, and several grinds of black pepper.
description.stepTwo: Mix in the eggs, then stir in the celery seed, dill, and chives. If desired, lightly mash the mixture if it's too chunky. Chill until ready to serve.

recipes.intro: These sandwich wraps are a perfect healthy lunch! They're fresh, satisfying, and packed with bold flavor from the zingy vinaigrette.

authors.name: Katie
authors.education: BA in English Literature from Loyola Marymount University, MS in Clinical Nutrition from New York University
authors.expertise: Healthy cooking, Family meals, Cooking with kids, Nutrition, Food Safety
authors.experience: Katie Morford is a culinary dietitian with a master's degree in clinical nutrition from New York University. She has 25 years of experience as a recipe developer, writer, and teacher. She has published three cookbooks focused on feeding a family and empowering kids of all ages to cook. Books: Best Lunchbox Ever (Chronicle Books 2013) nominated for an IACP award, Rise & Shine (Roost Books, 2016), PREP (Roost Books 2019) Blog: Mom's Kitchen Handbook, nominated for an IACP award Began working with Simply Recipes in late 2019.

authors.name: Elise
authors.education: Stanford University: BS in Environmental Science; MA in Food Research; MBA from the Graduate School of Business
authors.experience: Elise Bauer is the founder of SimplyRecipes.com. A blogging pioneer, Elise first created Simply Recipes in 2003 as a way to document her family’s recipes, and over the years grew it into one of the most popular cooking websites in the world. Elise grew up in a large family, the eldest of six. Her parents are both excellent scratch cooks—her mother by necessity to feed the family, and her father because he loves to eat well and experiment with trying out new recipes. Elise's mother’s heritage is Mexican American, from Tucson, Arizona, and her father, Germanic, from Minnesota. These duel influences shape Elise’s approach to home cooking, and she is just as happy making her mother’s enchiladas as she is preparing her father’s spare ribs with sauerkraut. Elise lived for a time in New England, as well as Japan, and her sweetheart is a dashing Frenchman from Provence, so you’ll find cuisines from those areas reflected in her recipes as well. lise’s recipes use mostly whole food ingredients, and only occasionally a few things from cans or prepared foods. She believes in a varied, healthy diet, using extra virgin olive oil, butter, eggs, lots of green vegetables, and protein from meat, fish, beans, and cheese.

authors.name: Summer
authors.education: BA in English Linguistics, University of Nebraska
authors.experience: Summer has 20 years of publishing experience working in media across all of its platforms: magazine, newspaper, and digital. Summer has spent the last 12 years working exclusively in food media where she has worked as a recipe developer, recipe tester, food journalist, essayist, cookbook author, and public speaker. Her work has appeared in Eating Well,Saveur, Bon Appétit, Grit and Edible Communities publications among others. She started working with Simply Recipes in 2017 where she has worked as a recipe tester, developer, associate editor and senior editor for the organization. She has won multiple awards for feature writing and social media campaigns throughout her career. Her book, New Prairie Kitchen, won the Nebraska Book Award for non-fiction in 2016 and Epicurious noted it as a “Need to Read” cookbook.

comments.title: Loved it
comments.description: I really like your recipes but it is getting hard to read them. I am older and the light gray is difficult to read.
comments.name: Diane

categories.title: Healthy Breakfast Ideas
categories.description: Stuck in a breakfast rut? Find over 60 healthy breakfast ideas below! With sweet, savory, easy & make-ahead options, we have something for everyone.

categories.title: Easy Dinner Ideas
categories.description: Wondering what to make for dinner? You're in the right place! Below, you'll find easy dinner ideas to satisfy any craving. Think tacos, pasta, and more!

categories.title: Best Salad Recipes
categories.description: A big, bountiful salad is the best way to celebrate delicious seasonal produce! Here are 51 stunning salad recipes I love to make again and again.

categories.title: Healthy Lunch Ideas
categories.description: If you're looking for new healthy lunch ideas, you're in the right place. These easy lunch recipes are fun, filling, and good for you, too!

aboutUs.title: About Us

whoWeAre.firstParagraph: Simply Recipes is here to help you cook delicious meals with less stress and more joy. We offer recipes and cooking advice for home cooks, by home cooks. Helping create “kitchen wins” is what we’re all about.
whoWeAre.secondParagraph: Simply Recipes was founded in 2003 by Elise Bauer as a home cooking blog to record her favorite family recipes. Today, Simply Recipes has grown into a trusted resource for home cooks with more than 3,000 tested recipes, guides, and meal plans, drawing over 15 million readers each month from around the world. We’re supported by a diverse group of recipe developers, food writers, recipe and product testers, photographers, and other creative professionals.

aboutUs.ourHistory: Elise Bauer was a busy Silicon Valley executive when she became sick with a flu that wouldn’t go away in 2001. In 2003, Elise moved home with her parents and lived with them for several years, recovering from chronic fatigue and documenting her parents’ cooking on Simply Recipes. (Here’s more of that story.) Over the years, what started as a small blog grew to reach millions of readers every month! In 2020, Simply Recipes was acquired by Dotdash Meredith, a New York-based media company.
aboutUs.recipeDevelopment: Our recipes primarily use fresh, unprocessed ingredients but we also believe there is a time and a place for canned, frozen, and other prepared ingredients. We believe in a diet that includes a wide variety of foods: real butter and cream, extra virgin olive oil, eggs, lots of fruits and vegetables, and protein from meat, fish, beans, and cheese. Plus cake for dessert.
aboutUs.contactUs: Have something you’d like to let us know? Whether you have a comment on a recipe or an idea to share, we would love to hear from you:
